intro: Bivonaea lutea, commonly known as the yellow bivonaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Bivonaea lutea is typically found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
